text: Butelka leżakowana ok 2 lat. W smaku silna karmelowa podstawa z wyraźnymi ciasteczkami, nutami dębiny i wanilii. Przepełnione ciemnymi owocami, rodzynkami, winogronami, oraz nutami winnymi. W tle delikatne ciasto czekoladowe. Goryczka niska. Alkohol wyraźnie wyczuwalny, co zaskakuje przy tak długim leżakowaniu. Na finiszu lekki grafit. Dobre, ale nieco poniżej oczekiwań.

Dark brown, ruby-colored pour with minimal, short-lived beige head. Notes of bourbon, dark malts, vanilla, raisins, candy sugar. Taste is mildly tart and woody with a strong, earmng, bourbon-like finish. Flavours develop subtly the aromas in perfect harmony - slightly smoked bourbon oak barrel, vanilla, dark fruits, raisins, cloves and pepper. Sticky, thick texture. Full body, low carbonation. Amazing.

375 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy mahogany, very small head that disappears immediately and completely. Great bourbon aroma, vanilla, oak, raisins, figs and toffee. Full-bodied, soft carbonated, silky and warm mouthfeel. Very pleasant bourbon taste through the sweet caramel malt. Vanilla, figs oak, dark chocolate and vermouth. Dry woody finish, which is also significantly warming with a great bourbon burn, now this I really like!

Pite w Carpe Kraft w ramach panelu. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta, ze sporą warstwą brązowej wręcz piany. W aromacie czuć wyraźnie wkład beczki, są przyjemne nuty dębowe, alkoholu ale też coś co przeszkadza nie do końca możliwe do określenia coś jak lakier. W smaku wyraźna waniliowość i rozgrzewający alkohol wraz z tą przeszkadzającą nutą lakieru.

Draft. Dark Brown, almost black. Very, very fruity (dark fruits, raisins, etc). Very malty (toffee, caramel, burnt sugar, vanilla, oak, hints of chocolate). Hints of whisky-like spirits. Very sweet. Enjoyed this. Fantastic beer! (2008)

Holzig säuerlicher Beginn, spritzig, getreidig-malzig. Minimale Karbonisierung, Rosinen, die milde aber dennoch aggressive Säuerlichkeit bleibt. Etwas Bourbon, Karamell, weiter Holz, die Komplexität bleibt. Langer säuerlich brotiger Nachhall. 10/11/11/11/12/11

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Smak och doft av stor söt doft av choklad, likörpralin, brunt socker, rom-russin, fat, bourbon, marsipan, vanilj och torkad frukt. Stor sötma och kropp, bra balans, rund och len, gott!

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Ingen kolsyra eller skum. Stor söt doft av romrussin, fat, bourbon, marsipan, vanlij och torkad frukt. Lite platt munkänsla trots riktigt stor kropp. Smaker som doften, bra balans men en lite vass smak i avslutningen. Känns inte 100%-ig men trots det är det riktigt bra. Men man blir ändå besviken.

Insanely oaky, raisins, leather, slightly boozy, vanilla, toffee, light coffee, rich yet velvety smooth. 
Murky Brown colour, small beige head. 
Heavy sweet, salty, lightly bitter, very warming, raisins, figs, oaky, vanilla, caramel, light notes of coffee. 
Fullbodied, soft velvety carbonation, oily feel, long complex Woody finish. 
Sublime!

2011 vintage with the orange label purchased at Julios Liquors God knows when. Neck reads 2010 Brandy. Meant to get to this sooner, now is the right time. (Thank god this isnt the infected vintage)Nose shows me deep dark fruit, vanilla and oak. Brandy is mild at this point 
Taste is again heavy on the dark fruits (raisin, plum, dates) some sticky sweet caramel with hints of vanilla. The finish shows oak. Mouthfeel is nearly full with carbonation on the lower side. Wow... Really wow. It is like liquid Brandy candy. This stands the test of time. I had the bourbon barrel on draft and this is just as impressive.
Flaska från Bishop Örebro. Mörkbrun, 3kompakt kulör med lätt smutsbrun skumkrona. Söt kropp. Smak av pumpernickel, knäck, farinsocker, portvin och tall.
Flaska bishops Örebro. Mörkbrun kulör. Doft av knäck, bourbon, mandelmassa, fikon och sirap. Liknande i smak. Fat och värmande alkohol

Bottle from Erzbierschof Zurich, 2011 vintage with 2010 shoulder print. Pours clear dark brown with almost no head. Intense brandy barrel indeed. Vanilla, wood, oak, some booze. Works well together though. Full and but not heavy body with almost no carbonation. Almost no bitterness, but sweet, almost a bit sticky, and some sourness. From the age maybe? Anyway, the booze is warming nicely as well done barley wines often do. Rather short palate, but it works. Good beer.
Bijna de pure perfectie. Dik vol mondgevoel. Licht boozy. Caramel, donker fruit, licht plakkerig. Tegen de port aan. Graag nog een fles !!

Black with iff white head - Dark malt and some woods in the aroma - Dark malt body with dark fruity and wood flavours that has some alcohol heat as well - The dark malt goes into the finish - This was good

2009 bottle, courtesy of jamesy -- cheers! It has all of the tastes and smells of a 7 year old barley wine; its slightly oxidized, malt-forward, and completely flat. But the flavors had melded together beautifully, with the malt sweetness mellowing a lot and no booze heat at all. Someone I was drinking it with started calling it "Jack Johnson" because its so mellow. I cant say I disagree.

Draft at Row 34. Pours black with a khaki head. Doesn't leave much lacing in the glass. Big bourbon notes on the nose. Lots of bourbon on the tongue. Hides it's booze well. Finished clean. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown, thin round of beige froth. Caramel, dark fruits, hints of sherry, raisins, hints of chocolate, liqeury notes in the aroma. Rich! Caramel, dark fruits, hints of caramel, hints of port, hints of berries. Dark fruits. Hints of chocolate in the end. Hints of cocoa and liqeury notes in the aftertaste. Silky structure, well balanced, rather heavy bodied, really enjoyable dessert.

On tap @ HO1K Beers. Pours a cinnamon brown color with a thin tan ring. Light aroma of bourbon. Flavor is mostly whiskey with some woody earthy notes. Not my favorite style. Too much whiskey flavor and not much else.

Un corps de fou, beaucoup de présence. On est sur la bière noble par excellence : nez relativement éthylique, des notes de vieillissement, du malt très présent, très caramélisé.
Bouche assez épaisse, notes champignonnees genre vieille cave. Beaucoup de fruits noirs, des notes légèrement vineuses.
Très profonde, manque peut être de subtilité mais incontestablement une grande bière.

Dark brown pour. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Borderline world class very complex nose of charred oak, candied dark fruit (plum, raisin), bourbon, light notes of tobacco and leather, caramel and prune over a slightly sweet malt base.

Medium body with a smooth texture that has some creaminess. Superb carbonation that is well balanced with the body providing a bit of effervescence in the middle and a nice burst in the finish.

The flavor profile is borderline world class, especially for 12.5% ABV. Survive the onslaught of the first few sips and you will be in for quite a treat after your palate normalizes. Alcohol astringency is very well covered with just a bit emerging in the finish. Balance is world class, for a beer of this strength and it is a brewing masterpiece. A lot goes on in this complex beer, yet each element has its moment on the stage. Bourbon never leaves the palate but ebbs and flows allowing others to pop to the surface. A sweet bourbon leads off then flows into caramel by the middle. Here the other flavors of the nose arrive in roughly the following order: tobacco and leather, oak - which lingers, dark fruits and finally prune. The finish delivers a final crescendo of rich caramel that ebbs as bourbon lingers in the remarkable slightly dry finish. A little heat at the back of the throat, but far less than typical for an ale of this strength.

sample from bottle, backlog, poured a murky brown colour with a few bubbles on the side. nose of sweet caramel, butterscotch, prunes, chocolate, vanilla, sweet bourbon, toffe, sticky mouthfeel. oak, balanced beer, lovely sipper.

On tap at Whole Foods Market - Chandler. The aroma presents scents of muted sweet baked apple, faint cinnamon, and minor brandy booziness with faint plum floating beneath. Pours murky reddish-brown. The brandy heat hits the tongue first but quickly gives way to a melange of sweet graham cracker, golden raisin, and wet oak flavors. A glowing warmth on the swallow showcases the booziness once more. Not bad, but not nearly as enjoyable or complex as Angels Share aged in bourbon barrels.

N: prunes, charamel, even some hops but mostly big beautiful oak character. Not the sweet spirity kind but fat and fruity and yeasty banana bonbons. Dark fruits galore. T: dark sugars and oaky tanins. Clear barleywine caramel.. Mouthfeel is oily and with low carb. Great fruity aftertaste with a semi hot and sweet Finnish

(bottle) Pours a black-brown complexion with quickly dissipating head. No glass lacing. Aroma of chocolate cherry cordial candy and alcohol.  The flavor is an intense deep malt with brandy, dried dark fruits and some anise.   Lingering palate.
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 Brown liquid with tan head. Aroma of toffee, caramel. Tastes same, nuts, heavy sweet, light bitter, light sour. Full body, oily feel, soft carbonisation, long finish

Bottle. Pours dark brown, almost no head. Aroma: chocolate, toffee, burnt caramel, sweet dark bread, dark berries. Taste is sweet, caramel, toffee, milk chocolate, some spicyness, Full body. sweet finish.Nice.

On tap it is dark brown with a small beige head. The aroma has booze, roasted malts and roasted fruits. Taste is big & boozy. There is some bourbon up front but smooth. Then there is some figs, plums and hint of vanilla. Great balance for such a young beer. Long finish, great beer.

12.7oz bottle, poured into a chalice. The aroma is a blend of leather, raisin, molasses, vanilla, light bourbon / rum, and oak. It pours a thick and muddy looking mahogany with a mild tan, soap head that leaves a light and wispy retention with mild lace. The taste is highly sweet with a complimentary medium bitterness. The texture is chewy with a soft, light fuzz, and a full body with notes of raisin and cherry, oak, molasses, and vanilla. The smooth finish is warm and boozy with vanilla rum and herbal notes, as well as oak and dark chocolate. Its aftertaste is woody and herbal with a light cherry touch, and is mostly clean.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is a strong and glorious Old Fashioned...bitter peels, cherry, bourbon...even some Scotch whiskey with herbal liqueur. Taste is a rum soaked raisins, dark fruits...cant get away from the Old Fashioned vibes. This is a thick boy, a boozy concoction, one for the ages and a very wonderful sipper. Wish there were more.

Cherry cordial is what strikes me in the aroma. It reminds of Christmas and the chocolates my parents would get from my aunts and uncles. It's has a boozy bite but sweet inviting flavor. Rich brown color.

Black Pour.

Sweet vanilla nose, lots of bourbon. 

Same goes for flavor. Really smooth, creamy thick darkness wkth lots of vanillins!

Bottle @ Steasys. Thanks for sharing! Deep amber pour with a small off-white head. Surprisingly fruity nose. Cherry and strawberry skin. A bit of fudge. Fruit and caramel dessert. Flavor skews sweet. Nutella spread and caramel. Light fruitiness. A bit hot. Full and rich. A nice sipper.

Opaque, no lace. 
Full body, silky, aggressively alcoholic and hot mouthfeel, flavorful, avg length. 
Sweet, mildly bitter. 
Vanilla, alcohol taste. 
Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
